contraindication.observationTitle: Severe allergic reaction after previous dose of Pneumococcal
contraindication.contraindicationText: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of Pneumococcal vaccine.
Do not vaccinate if the patient has had an adverse reaction to a vaccine component.

contraindication.observationTitle: Severe allergic reaction to diphtheria toxoid
contraindication.contraindicationText: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction to diphtheria toxoid.

series.seriesName: Pneumococcal 4-dose series
series.seriesAdminGuidance: If only PCV13 is available when the child is scheduled to receive a PCV, PCV13 may be given as previously recommended.

set.setDescription: Target Dose not required if current dose was administered on or after 24 months - 4 days of age.
Target Dose not required for those who are 24 months of age or older.
Target Dose is not required if the current dose was administered on or after 12 months of age
Target Dose is not required if the current dose was administered on or after 12 months - 4 days of age AND at least 8 weeks - 4 days from the previous dose
Dose is not required for those 12 months or older
Dose is not required if the patient has received 1 or more doses of PCV13, PCV15, or PCV20

series.seriesName: Pneumococcal dose 2 at 7 months series
series.seriesAdminGuidance: If only PCV13 is available when the child is scheduled to receive a PCV, PCV13 may be given as previously recommended.

set.setDescription: Dose is not required for those 7 months or older
Dose is not required if the patient has received 1 or more doses of PCV13, PCV15, or PCV20

series.seriesName: Pneumococcal start at 12 months series
series.seriesAdminGuidance: If only PCV13 is available when the child is scheduled to receive a PCV, PCV13 may be given as previously recommended.

set.setDescription: Dose is not required if the patient has received 1 or more doses of PCV13, PCV15, or PCV20

series.seriesName: Pneumococcal start at 24 months series
series.seriesAdminGuidance: If only PCV13 is available when the child is scheduled to receive a PCV, PCV13 may be given as previously recommended.

set.setDescription: Dose is not required if the patient has received 1 or more doses of PCV13, PCV15, or PCV20

series.seriesName: Pneumococcal risk 2-5 years Chronic Medical Conditions PCV-PCV-PPSV series
series.seriesAdminGuidance: If only PCV13 is available when the child is scheduled to receive a PCV, PCV13 may be given as previously recommended.

indication.description: Administer to persons who have cerebrospinal fluid leaks.
Administer to persons who have cochlear implants.
indication.guidance: When cochlear implant placement is being planned, PCV13 and/or PPSV23 vaccination should be completed at least 2 weeks before surgery or initiation of therapy.

indication.description: Administer to persons who have diabetes.
Administer to persons who have chronic liver disease.
Administer to persons who have chronic heart disease.
Administer to persons who have chronic lung disease.
Administer to persons with chronic kidney disease
Administer to persons with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease
Administer to persons with emphysema

observationCode.text: Moderate persistent or severe persistent asthma

indication.description: Administer to persons who have moderate persistent or severe persistent asthma.
indication.guidance: Administer regardless of high-dose oral corticosteroids use

set.setDescription: Dose is not required if the patient has a complete standard series AND 0 doses before 12 months AND 2 or more doses between 12 and 24 months
Dose is not required if the patient has a complete standard series AND 3 or more doses before 24 months.
Dose is not required if the patient has a complete standard series AND 0 doses before 12 months AND 2 or more doses between 12 and 24 months
Dose is not required if the patient has a complete standard series AND 3 or more doses before 24 months.
Dose is not required if the patient has received 1 or more doses of PCV20 or PPSV23

series.seriesName: Pneumococcal risk 2-5 years Chronic Medical Conditions PCV-PPSV-PCV series
series.seriesAdminGuidance: If only PCV13 is available when the child is scheduled to receive a PCV, PCV13 may be given as previously recommended.

indication.description: Administer to persons who have moderate persistent or severe persistent asthma.
indication.guidance: Administer regardless of high-dose oral corticosteroids use

set.setDescription: Dose is not required if the patient has a complete standard series AND 0 doses before 12 months AND 2 or more doses between 12 and 24 months
Dose is not required if the patient has a complete standard series AND 3 or more doses before 24 months.
Dose is not required if the patient has a complete standard series AND 0 doses before 12 months AND 2 or more doses between 12 and 24 months
Dose is not required if the patient has a complete standard series AND 3 or more doses before 24 months.

series.seriesName: Pneumococcal risk 2-5 years Chronic Medical Conditions PPSV-PCV-PCV series
series.seriesAdminGuidance: If only PCV13 is available when the child is scheduled to receive a PCV, PCV13 may be given as previously recommended.

indication.description: Administer to persons who have cerebrospinal fluid leaks.
Administer to persons who have cochlear implants.
indication.guidance: When cochlear implant placement is being planned, PCV13 and/or PPSV23 vaccination should be completed at least 2 weeks before surgery or initiation of therapy.

indication.description: Administer to persons who have diabetes.
Administer to persons who have chronic liver disease.
Administer to persons who have chronic heart disease.
Administer to persons who have chronic lung disease.
Administer to persons with chronic kidney disease
Administer to persons with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease
Administer to persons with emphysema

observationCode.text: Moderate persistent or severe persistent asthma

indication.description: Administer to persons who have moderate persistent or severe persistent asthma.
indication.guidance: Administer regardless of high-dose oral corticosteroids use

set.setDescription: Dose is not required if the patient has a complete standard series AND 0 doses before 12 months AND 2 or more doses between 12 and 24 months
Dose is not required if the patient has a complete standard series AND 3 or more doses before 24 months.
Dose is not required if the patient has a complete standard series AND 0 doses before 12 months AND 2 or more doses between 12 and 24 months
Dose is not required if the patient has a complete standard series AND 3 or more doses before 24 months.

series.seriesName: Pneumococcal risk 2-5 years 4-dose series
series.seriesAdminGuidance: If only PCV13 is available when the child is scheduled to receive a PCV, PCV13 may be given as previously recommended.

indication.description: Administer to hemodialysis patients and predialysis, peritoneal dialysis, and home dialysis patients
Administer to persons who have severe B-lymphocyte (humoral) - antibody deficiencies (e.g., X-linked agammaglobulinemia and common variable immunodeficiency).
Administer to persons who have less severe B-lymphocyte (humoral) - antibody deficiencies (e.g., selective IgA deficiency and IgG subclass deficiency).
Administer to persons who have complete cell-mediated or humoral T-lymphocyte defects (e.g., severe combined immunodeficiency [SCID] disease, complete DiGeorge syndrome).
Administer to persons who have partial cell-mediated or humoral T-lymphocyte defects (e.g., most patients with DiGeorge syndrome, Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome, ataxia- telangiectasia).

observationCode.text: Persistent complement, properdin, or factor B deficiency

indication.description: Administer to persons who have persistent complement component deficiencies, particularly C1, C2, C3, and C4 deficiencies.

observationCode.text: Phagocytic function - Leukocyte adhesion defect, and myeloperoxidase deficiency

indication.description: Administer to persons who have a phagocytic function defect (e.g. leukocyte adhesion defect and myeloperoxidase deficiency).
Administer to persons who have generalized malignant neoplasm.
Administer to persons who have received a solid organ transplant.

Administer to persons who are undergoing immunosuppressive therapy. Immunosuppressive medications include those given to prevent solid organ transplant rejection, human immune mediators like interleukins and colony-stimulating factors, immune modulators like levamisol and BCG bladder-tumor therapy, and medicines like tumor necrosis factor alpha inhibitors and anti-B cell antibodies.
indication.guidance: When immunocompromising therapy is being planned, PCV13 and/or PPSV23 vaccination should be completed at least 2 weeks before surgery or initiation of therapy.

indication.description: Administer to persons who are undergoing radiation therapy.
indication.guidance: When immunocompromising therapy is being planned, PCV13 and/or PPSV23 vaccination should be completed at least 2 weeks before surgery or initiation of therapy.

indication.description: Administer to persons with anatomic or functional asplenia, including sickle cell disease.
indication.guidance: When elective splenectomy is being planned, PCV13 and/or PPSV23 vaccination should be completed at least 2 weeks before surgery or initiation of therapy.

indication.description: Administer to persons with nephrotic syndrome.
Administer to persons with leukemia.
Administer to persons with lymphoma.
Administer to persons with Hodgkin's disease.
Administer to persons with HIV Infection
Administer to persons with iatrogenic Immunosupression

set.setDescription: Dose is not required if the patient has a complete standard series AND 0 doses before 12 months AND 2 or more doses between 12 and 24 months
Dose is not required if the patient has a complete standard series AND 3 or more doses before 24 months.
Dose is not required if the patient has a complete standard series AND 0 doses before 12 months AND 2 or more doses between 12 and 24 months
Dose is not required if the patient has a complete standard series AND 3 or more doses before 24 months.
Dose is not required if the patient has received 1 or more doses of PCV20 or PPSV23
Dose is not required if the patient has received 2 or more doses of PPSV23 OR 1 or more doses of PCV20

indication.guidance: Administer regardless of high-dose oral corticosteroids use

set.setDescription: Dose is not required if the patient has received 1 or more total doses to date
Dose is not required if patient has received a PCV20 on or after 2 years of age

set.setDescription: Dose is not required if the patient has received 1 or more total doses to date

series.seriesName: Pneumococcal risk 19+ Chronic Medical Conditions PCV-PPSV series
series.seriesAdminGuidance: Adults who have received PCV13 please consult the following for PCV20, PCV21 or PPSV23 options: https://www.cdc.gov/pneumococcal/downloads/Vaccine-Timing-Adults-JobAid.pdf

Based on shared clinical decision-making, 1 dose of PCV20 or PCV21 may be administered at least 5 years after the last pneumococcal vaccine dose provided the patient previously received both PCV13 and PPSV23 with at least one dose of PPSV23 received on or after 65 years of age.

Administer to persons who have chronic lung disease.

Administer to persons who have alcoholism.
Administer to persons with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease
Administer to persons with emphysema

set.setDescription: Dose is not required if the patient has received 1 or more total doses to date
Dose is not required if patient has received a PCV20 on or after 2 years of age
Dose is not required if patient has received a PCV21 on or after 19 years of age
Dose is not required if patient has already received one dose of PPSV on or after 65 years of age.
Dose is not required if patient received a valid PCV15, PCV20, or PCV21
Dose is not required if patient received PCV15 or PCV20 on or after age 6 years
Dose is not required if patient received PCV21 on or after age 19 years
Dose is not required if patient received PCV13 and no PCV15, PCV20, or PCV21 on or after age 6 years

series.seriesName: Pneumococcal risk 19+ years Chonic Medical Conditions PPSV-PCV series
series.seriesAdminGuidance: Adults who have received PCV13 please consult the following for PCV20, PCV21 or PPSV23 options: https://www.cdc.gov/pneumococcal/downloads/Vaccine-Timing-Adults-JobAid.pdf

Based on shared clinical decision-making, 1 dose of PCV20 or PCV21 may be administered at least 5 years after the last pneumococcal vaccine dose provided the patient previously received both PCV13 and PPSV23 with at least one dose of PPSV23 received on or after 65 years of age.

indication.description: Administer to persons who have diabetes.

Administer to persons who have chronic heart disease.
Administer to persons who have chronic lung disease.
Administer to persons who have asthma.
Administer to persons who smoke cigarettes.
Administer to persons who have alcoholism.
Administer to persons with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease
Administer to persons with emphysema

set.setDescription: Dose is not required if the patient has received 1 or more total doses to date
Dose is not required if patient has already received one dose of PPSV on or after 65 years of age.
Dose is not required if patient received a valid PCV15, PCV20, or PCV21
Dose is not required if patient received PCV15 or PCV20 on or after age 6 years
Dose is not required if patient received PCV21 on or after age 19 years
Dose is not required if patient received PCV13 and no PCV15, PCV20, or PCV21 on or after age 6 years

series.seriesName: Pneumococcal risk 19+ years CSF Leaks or Cochlear Implants PCV-PPSV series
series.seriesAdminGuidance: Adults who have received PCV13 please consult the following for PCV20, PCV21 or PPSV23 options: https://www.cdc.gov/pneumococcal/downloads/Vaccine-Timing-Adults-JobAid.pdf

When PCV15 is used, the recommended interval between administration of PCV15 and PPSV23 is on or after 1 year. A minimum interval of 8 weeks can be considered for adults with an immunocompromising condition, cochlear implant, or cerebrospinal fluid leak to minimize the risk for IPD caused by serotypes unique to PPSV23 in these vulnerable groups

Based on shared clinical decision-making, 1 dose of PCV20 or PCV21 may be administered at least 5 years after the last pneumococcal vaccine dose provided the patient previously received both PCV13 and PPSV23 with at least one dose of PPSV23 received on or after 65 years of age.

indication.description: Administer to persons who have cerebrospinal fluid leaks.
Administer to persons who have cochlear implants.
indication.guidance: When cochlear implant placement is being planned, PCV and/or PPSV23 vaccination should be completed at least 2 weeks before surgery or initiation of therapy.

set.setDescription: Dose is not required if the patient has received 1 or more total doses to date
Dose is not required if patient has received a PCV20 on or after 2 years of age
Dose is not required if patient has received a PCV21 on or after 19 years of age
Dose is not required if patient has already received one dose of PPSV on or after 65 years of age.
Dose is not required if patient received PCV15 or PCV20 on or after age 6 years
Dose is not required if patient received PCV21 on or after age 19 years
Dose is not required if patient received PCV15 or PCV20 on or after age 6 years
Dose is not required if patient received PCV21 on or after age 19 years
Dose is not required if patient received PCV13 and no PCV15, PCV20, or PCV21 on or after age 6 years

series.seriesName: Pneumococcal risk 19+ years CSF Leaks or Cochlear Implants PPSV-PCV series
series.seriesAdminGuidance: Adults who have received PCV13 please consult the following for PCV20, PCV21 or PPSV23 options: https://www.cdc.gov/pneumococcal/downloads/Vaccine-Timing-Adults-JobAid.pdf

Based on shared clinical decision-making, 1 dose of PCV20 or PCV21 may be administered at least 5 years after the last pneumococcal vaccine dose provided the patient previously received both PCV13 and PPSV23 with at least one dose of PPSV23 received on or after 65 years of age.

When PCV15 is used, the recommended interval between administration of PCV15 and PPSV23 is on or after 1 year. Administer to persons with Hodgkin's disease.
Administer to persons with multiple myeloma.
Administer to persons with HIV Infection
Administer to persons with iatrogenic Immunosupression

set.setDescription: Dose is not required if the patient has received 1 or more total doses to date
Dose is not required if patient has received a PCV20 on or after 6 years of age
Dose is not required if patient has received a PCV21 on or after 19 years of age
Dose is not required if patient has already received one dose of PPSV on or after 65 years of age.
Dose is not required if patient received PCV15 or PCV20 on or after age 6 years
Dose is not required if patient received PCV21 on or after age 19 years
Dose is not required if patient has already received one dose of PPSV on or after 65 years of age.
Dose is not required if patient received PCV15 or PCV20 on or after age 6 years
Dose is not required if patient received PCV21 on or after age 19 years
Dose is not required if patient received PCV15 or PCV20 on or after age 6 years
Dose is not required if patient received PCV21 on or after age 19 years
Dose is not required if patient received PCV13 and no PCV15, PCV20, or PCV21 on or after age 6 years

series.seriesName: Pneumococcal risk 19+ years immunocompromised PPSV-PCV-PPSV series
series.seriesAdminGuidance: Adults who have received PCV13 please consult the following for PCV20, PCV21 or PPSV23 options: https://www.cdc.gov/pneumococcal/downloads/Vaccine-Timing-Adults-JobAid.pdf

Based on shared clinical decision-making, 1 dose of PCV20 or PCV21 may be administered at least 5 years after the last pneumococcal vaccine dose provided the patient previously received both PCV13 and PPSV23 with at least one dose of PPSV23 received on or after 65 years of age.

indication.description: Administer to hemodialysis patients and predialysis, peritoneal dialysis, and home dialysis patients
Administer to persons who have severe B-lymphocyte (humoral) - antibody deficiencies (e.g., X-linked agammaglobulinemia and common variable immunodeficiency).
Administer to persons who have less severe B-lymphocyte (humoral) - antibody deficiencies (e.g., selective IgA deficiency and IgG subclass deficiency).
Administer to persons who have complete cell-mediated or humoral T-lymphocyte defects (e.g., severe combined immunodeficiency [SCID] disease, complete DiGeorge syndrome).
Administer to persons who have partial cell-mediated or humoral T-lymphocyte defects (e.g., most patients with DiGeorge syndrome, Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome, ataxia- telangiectasia).

observationCode.text: Persistent complement, properdin, or factor B deficiency

indication.description: Administer to persons who have persistent complement component deficiencies, particularly C1, C2, C3, and C4 deficiencies.

observationCode.text: Phagocytic function - Leukocyte adhesion defect, and myeloperoxidase deficiency

indication.description: Administer to persons who have a phagocytic function defect (e.g. leukocyte adhesion defect and myeloperoxidase deficiency).
Administer to persons who have generalized malignant neoplasm.
Administer to persons who have received a solid organ transplant.

Administer to persons who are undergoing immunosuppressive therapy. Immunosuppressive medications include those given to prevent solid organ transplant rejection, human immune mediators like interleukins and colony-stimulating factors, immune modulators like levamisol and BCG bladder-tumor therapy, and medicines like tumor necrosis factor alpha inhibitors and anti-B cell antibodies.
indication.guidance: When immunocompromising therapy is being planned, PCV and/or PPSV23 vaccination should be completed at least 2 weeks before surgery or initiation of therapy.

indication.description: Administer to persons who are undergoing radiation therapy.
indication.guidance: When immunocompromising therapy is being planned, PCV and/or PPSV23 vaccination should be completed at least 2 weeks before surgery or initiation of therapy.

indication.description: Administer to persons with anatomic or functional asplenia, including sickle cell disease.
indication.guidance: When elective splenectomy is being planned, PCV and/or PPSV23 vaccination should be completed at least 2 weeks before surgery or initiation of therapy.

indication.description: Administer to persons with nephrotic syndrome.
Administer to persons with leukemia.
Administer to persons with lymphoma.
Administer to persons with Hodgkin's disease.
Administer to persons with multiple myeloma.
Administer to persons with HIV Infection
Administer to persons with iatrogenic Immunosupression

Dose is not required if patient has already received one dose of PPSV on or after 65 years of age.
